title.narrative: SSC between DK and Mexico on strengthening primary healthcare

description.narrative:
The Strategic Sector Cooperation on Health aims to strengthen primary healthcare in Mexico by supporting the Federal Secretariat of Health in Mexico in the implementation of the Comprehensive Healthcare Model by:
- Strengthening capacity in primary healthcare -Strengthening the management of pharmaceuticals at national level.

The Strategic Sector Cooperation on Health is a peer-to-peer cooperation between the Danish ministry of Health and the mexican Federal Secretariat of Health / Secretariat of Health in the state of Tabasco. The cooperation will strengthen capacity in primary healthcare and the management of pharmaceuticals in Mexico.
A Strategic Sector Cooperation (SSC) is a partnership aiming at improving sector framework conditions in a partner country. The initiative is a flexible and adaptive instrument for exchanging experiences, learning and capacity building, which builds on a consolidated strong relationship and trust between the involved authorities. The commitment to finance the Danish authorities’ participation is sequenced in phases; an inception phase of approximately one year resulting in a project document; followed by phase one, two and –if need be – a phase three during which the cooperation is deepened and developed. All SSC partnerships are supported by a sector advisor at the embassy, who impel progress and stir the partnership in the direction agreed upon. Annually, the SSC projects deliver a report on project progress and results achieved. Progress on selected outputs are displayed in openaid.
In order to prepare a phase 2 of the SSC cooperation, phase 1 has been extended to 2021.
